intro: Palicourea crocochlamys, commonly known as the red-flowered palicourea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often glossy and dark green. Its most distinctive feature is the clusters of bright red, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is also noted for its aromatic leaves and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
